clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Bronchiolitis in Infants and Allergic Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: Risk of Allergic Asthma Occurring in the Long Term From an Episode of Acute Bronchiolitis in Infants: Clinical, Allergological and Functional Evaluation in the Long Term

brief_summary.textblock:
Predicting the risk of allergenic sensitizations and asthma development in the first year of life is difficult.
Investigator decided to follow prospectively two cohorts of infants with acute bronchiolitis, hospitalized or treated at home, from the epidemic seasons of 2011-2012 and 2015-2017 to know their respiratory evolution, especially if they developed allergen sensitization and / or asthma.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk factors for asthma 6 years after an episode of acute bronchiolitis

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between onset of asthma and severity of bronchiolitis
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of acute bronchiolitis, assessed by a clinical score based on control signs, spO2 and respiratory rate (Wainwright score) and the length of hospital stay

secondary_outcome.measure: relationship between KL-6 serum markers and the occurrence of longer-term asthma
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between onset of asthma and concentration of KL-6 during bronchiolitis

secondary_outcome.measure: relationship between CC16 serum markers and the occurrence of longer-term asthma
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between onset of asthma and concentration of CC16 during bronchiolitis.

secondary_outcome.measure: relationship between sRAGE serum markers and the occurrence of longer-term asthma
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between onset of asthma and concentration of sRAGE during bronchiolitis

arm_group.description: cohorts of infants with acute bronchiolitis

intervention.description: Consultation with a pneumopediatrician: collection of respiratory symptoms, respiratory treatments, evaluation of the atopic site and environmental risk factors for bronchial aggression, especially passive smoking
